page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This area of{Essex}is composed of parts of the parishes of Debden, Debden Green, Hamperden End, Cutlers Green and Wimbish. It is mainly {farmland}although some 85 hectares are {woodland}managed by the Forestry Commission. Most of the housing is old mainly{thatched cottages.}There is one general store and Post Office together with a garage at Debden Green, but no other shops. Most of the people shop in the local town of{Saffron Walden}or in Bishop's Stortford or Cambridge. The majority of working people do in fact work in Saffron Walden or the surrounding villages. However a fair proportion{commute}to either London or Cambridge. Manual jobs such as {building and decorating}employ several people but very few people work on the land due to the highly mechanised nature of{farming.
